html:
The Canon USA store has Canon 10×32 IS Image Stabilized Binoculars at an incredible price. You can grab a set of these binoculars for nearly 50% if you go the refurbished route.

  • Lens-Shift Image Stabilization
  • Field-Flattener Lens System
  • Super Spectra Multi-Coated Optics
  • Normal and Powered IS Modes
  • Simple 2-Button User Interface
  • Large Center Focusing Wheel
  • Fold-Down Rubber Eyecups
  • Runs on Two AA Batteries
  • Weight: 27.5 Ounces

Purchase Options

  • Canon 10×32 IS Image Stabilized Binoculars $499 (Refurbished)
  • Canon 10×32 IS Image Stabilized Binoculars $939 (Retail)

Canon 10×32 IS Image Stabilized Binoculars Overview

Adapting the IS system from their line of EF lenses, the Canon 10×32 IS Image Stabilized Binoculars employ a lens-shift system uses a combination of a vibration gyro-mechanism and microprocessors that detect and counter the appearance of hand-shake by moving the internal lens assembly to make the image appear steady.

Two IS modes allow the performance to be tailored to the situation: Normal IS is ideal for moving or multiple subjects, while Powered IS improves the stabilization when observing a single stationary subject.

An intuitive two-button user interface makes choosing the mode simple and easy. The IS runs on two included AA batteries, and when not using the image stabilization, the optic will operate as a conventional pair of binoculars.

Purchase Options

  • Canon 10×32 IS Image Stabilized Binoculars $499 (Reg $939) Refurbished
  • Canon 10×32 IS Image Stabilized Binoculars $939 (Retail)
